body: Ah, and I tried so hard to trigger it with a working websocket connection... :laughing: Then this should be easy to fix, and is likely unconnected to the other websocket panic we've seen...

issue.title: fix(ws): return error before running setup fn if WS is not connectable

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
This is a very naive fix for #1116: it ensures the WS connection is established before running the setup function.

This avoids the panic and running the test script provided by @MStoykov now outputs:

```
ERRO[0011] GoError: lookup nonexistant on 172.16.1.1:53: no such host
        at native
        at file:///home/ivan/.local/go/src/github.com/loadimpact/k6/test-ws.js:5:61(14)
```

Closes #1116

issue.title: Websocket reconnect panic

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0
